event_name: Beats x Bass x Cologne in Odonien #MittWochenende
lineup: #Beats (Techno):, Ropemaker (Techno Allianz), Kevin Arnold (Kassiopeia/ Bootshaus), Ventris (Kassiopeia), , #Bass(Drum&Bass):, DSTN (Beats x Bass x Cologne), Enaly (Beats x Bass x Cologne), Sixten (Wave)
information:
Discover the pulse of Cologne every Wednesday at Beats x Bass x Cologne—the city’s go-to midweek techno and drum & bass gathering. Held at Odonien, a truly unique venue where art meets music, this night promises an unforgettable dive into underground sounds.

Odonien, the brainchild of artist Odo Rumpf, is more than just a venue—it’s an immersive experience. Situated in Ehrenfeld between the train tracks and Europe’s largest Eroscenter, this former scrapyard has evolved into a cultural oasis. With an open-air studio, artist workshops, event halls, and a vibrant beer garden adorned with striking metal sculptures, Odonien’s raw, industrial aesthetic is like stepping into a Mad Max-inspired playground for the arts.

Each week, Beats x Bass x Cologne hosts a lineup of local and international DJs, bringing high-energy beats and deep basslines to life. Dance under the stars amidst monumental sculptures and cutting-edge installations, fully immersing yourself in the city’s underground music scene.

Whether you’re a Cologne local or just passing through, join us for a midweek session that fuses the city’s alternative spirit with the power of techno and drum & bass. This is Cologne nightlife like you’ve never experienced before.

event_name: Das ist das Ja feat. fatmuska, Jan Oben, Play Boy Joe b2b FENIM0RE
lineup: fatmuska, Play Boy Joe b2b Fenim0re, Jan Oben
information:
"Das ist das Ja", a collective that came together in Aachen and gave us a wonderful evening last October, is now back and presents an exciting line-up from the electronic club scene:

fatmuska - is a Halle-based DJ and member of the music and artist collective OG2G. Her sets are characterized by driving rhythms and melodic elements. Inspired by breaks and different genres, she mixes together a diverse range of music.

FENIM0RE - the Cologne-based producer and DJ has a deep passion for analog sound that shines through in his music. Known for his funky and dubby stabs, catchy grooves and rhythms, he aims to convey a seamless harmony between sound and physical movement, igniting euphoria and anticipation and inviting the listener into a transformative world of sound.

Jan Oben - has paved his way as a DJ from organic to electronic music, shaping his unmistakable sound in the process. This development can still be heard in his sets today, in which he plays a variety of rhythms and sounds from all corners of the world. His focus is on driving percussive elements, which he combines with powerful basslines.

Play Boy Joe - is co-founder of "This is the Yes". He regularly releases music on this label, as well as on numerous independent national and international labels. His style is too techno for house heads and too housey for techno purists, making it the perfect balance for anyone who doesn't like to be pigeonholed.

lineup: Skippo TheElectricTaste Alalkih, QueerMum, MadGirlsInTown, Laila Licious, Pierlucien, Emilia, The Only Naomy, Angel, Janisha Jones, Pasta Parisa
information:
Hier wird Geschichte geschrieben: Thank you for 17 yrs Babies! 
.
In den Tiefen der Großstadtnächte, existiert eine Party, die den Puls der Szene bestimmt. Sie hat die Schatten durchschritten, die Dunkelheit durchbrochen und sich als Original und strahlendes Licht der freien Liebe in Köln etabliert. Seit 17 Jahren tanzt sie also durch die Stadt, unaufhaltsam, unersättlich, und immer wieder noch heißer als zuvor. Jede Nacht eine neue Prophezeiung, jedes Jahr ein neues Kapitel. Am 12ten Oktober öffnet sie erneut ihre Pforten und lädt alle ein, Teil dieses BirthdayBashs zu werden! Seid dabei, bei der Nacht, die sich selbst übertrifft
.
P O P O L A P O P
Zieh dein fiercestes Outfit an und mach dich bereit, den Popp-Floor zu überfluten! Unsere Remixe, Indie, Hits und MashUps sind nicht nur Pop, sie sind Kult! Die niederländischen Star-Djanes „Robin Elyza“ und „Josie Rk.“, scharren schon mit den Pumps, ALLES auszupacken. „QueerMum“ ist natürlich mit am Start und glitzert, tanzt und slayt extra schön auf die biersaufenden TopModels! Den Rahmen zu diesem – ja, kosmischen Ereignis – stecken die GoGos „TheOnlyNaomy“ und „Angel“: There’s nothing basic – all extra!
.
L I V E
Wenn „Pasta Parisa“ und „Janisha Jones“, die unantastbaren Badass-Ikonen der Münchner Queer-Szene, die Bühne betreten, wird es eine wilde Fahrt direkt ins Herz der Extravaganz. Glitter trifft auf Gänsehaut, und was du für Kunst gehalten hast, entpuppt sich als knallharter Reality-Check, da die Gurls Charisma mit Chainsaws performen! Watch out!
.
"Emilia" und "Pierlucien": Ein strahlendes Festival, das die Sinne zum Kochen bringt. Emilia, eine Göttin, tanzt Pracht und Magie. Pierlucien - der brillanteste Performer, seit es Sex-Appeal gibt! Ihre Metamorphose verwandelt die Bühne in einen Begeisterungsschrei der Glückshormone, ihre Show macht aus Rhythmus und Sound ein außerirdisches Spektakel. Rebellion und Entertainment als queeres Kunstwerk, das Schönheit völlig neu erfindet
.
T E C H N O
Du liebst es hart und deep? Im Techno-Floor trifft Minimalismus auf maximale Intensität.
Garantiert extrovertiert: Bei „Skippo“, „TheElectricTaste“ & „Alalkih“ gibt es kein Drumherum, nur direkte Vibes, die den Ton angeben. Techno ist nicht nur Beat, es ist ein Zustand. Und wenn du bereit bist, ihn zu fühlen, bist du bei uns im geilsten Techno-Keller genau richtig. Keine Pausen, keine Ausreden! Hier gilt: Weniger ist mehr – außer beim Sound! No filters, just raw beats. Das ist keine Party, das ist eine Religion. Dance, bit*h, dance!
.
B A R
Die stilbewusste Mother of Glam, „Laila Licious“, spielt sich jubilierend durch die letzten 17 Jahre und feiert alle um den Verstand!
Attitude? Unapologetic
.
Lass deine innere Rampensasu raus und bring alle deine Queens mit – diese Nacht wird frei gefeiert!
.
Babies, es gibt was zu erledigen:
Happy Happy Birthday 
Fühlt euch frei und feiert heftigst!
.

event_name: Tom-Tom Club feat. Jonas Landwehr & Dimon
lineup: Jonas Landwehr , Dimon
information:
Tom-Tom Club is an open space for exchange, discovery and boundless, genre-free musical adventures. Local scenes and new ideas are highlighted and promoted here. Meet up in your favorite living room and be surprised!

With 'till things ghost', Cologne label operator Jonas Landwehr (Serial Sound) has released his solo debut. And a very personal one at that. After releasing collaborations or various artist EPs, he was now ready for this step and shares his diverse taste with us. The EP internalizes the play with different rhythms. Several styles such as house, techno or dancehall as well as different tempos come together on this project. Pioneering. Emotional. Danceable.

The innovative selection by Dimon fits perfectly into the evening. Whether peak time, warm-up or after-hours - he always creates a unique atmosphere on the dancefloor. Characteristic is his deep and chunky house selection, combined with everything the bass landscape has to offer.

lineup: Lineup will be announced asap!
information:
Discover the pulse of Cologne every Wednesday at Beats x Bass x Cologne—the city’s go-to midweek techno and drum & bass gathering. Held at Odonien, a truly unique venue where art meets music, this night promises an unforgettable dive into underground sounds.

Odonien, the brainchild of artist Odo Rumpf, is more than just a venue—it’s an immersive experience. Situated in Ehrenfeld between the train tracks and Europe’s largest Eroscenter, this former scrapyard has evolved into a cultural oasis. With an open-air studio, artist workshops, event halls, and a vibrant beer garden adorned with striking metal sculptures, Odonien’s raw, industrial aesthetic is like stepping into a Mad Max-inspired playground for the arts.

Each week, Beats x Bass x Cologne hosts a lineup of local and international DJs, bringing high-energy beats and deep basslines to life. Dance under the stars amidst monumental sculptures and cutting-edge installations, fully immersing yourself in the city’s underground music scene.

Whether you’re a Cologne local or just passing through, join us for a midweek session that fuses the city’s alternative spirit with the power of techno and drum & bass. This is Cologne nightlife like you’ve never experienced before.

event_name: Odonien RECORDS invites METANOÏA (Lyon, France)
lineup: Suerte (2) b2b Kuiper Belt Objects, Krimska b2b Hypersapoid, Ysossios b2b GIO, Cyrus, Ulla b2b Fabian Porter , Bach & Blüte , awid Helguera b2b Matti Spe , strokr , Lemonara
information:
At this Label Night, we're celebrating French-German culture with 3 exciting b2b sets. We're honored to welcome the Lyon-based collective METANOÏA, featuring SUERTE, Krimska, and Ysossios. Each will pair up with our resident DJs KBO, Hypersapoid, and Gio for an exciting back-to-back performance in the genres: Techno, Trance, and UK Bass. The b2b concept will exchangely take place in Lyon at Terminal Club ( @terminalclub )  on 31st October.
Our intention is to highlight the rich diversity and shared values of both cultures through music. 

*w / TECHNO, TRANCE, UK BASS*

- SUERTE (METANOÏA, Lyon) B2B KBO (Odonien Records, Cologne)-

SUERTE’s strength lies in her eclectic tastes, her energy, and her emotions. Nurtured by industrial techno and synths with a cyber-neorave and hard techno vibe, she later gravitates toward a groovy, colorful, and trippy universe, often much faster: breakbeat, dubtek, Trance, etc. She quickly establishes herself on the Lyon scene. Through her project initiative, Metanoïa, she commits to bringing a space of free expression, awareness, and sharing to the party scene. The motto: freedom of expression. 
@suerte__

Kuiper Belt Objects who has released his trance anthem "Planet 9" on Odonien Records V/A Sampler ODO005. He is the synthesist of OR's live duo Hyeena and will kick off with a mix of trance, bass music/breakbeat, and techno.
@kuiperbeltobjects

-Krimska (METANOÏA, Lyon)B2BHypersapoid (Odonien Records, Cologne) -

Krimska is a DJ and producer whose musical journey is deeply influenced by the Czech scene. Her sets are free of all genre boundaries and aim to offer a colorful and hybrid selection. Her strong taste for groove and broken rhythms enables her to create dynamic sets in which rhythm and sound never cease to mingle and transform. As a resident of the Métanoïa collective, Krimska defends not only her artistic vision but also the values of inclusivity and respect within the electronic music scene, with a deep commitment to musical diversity.
@krimskaaa

Hypersapoid is a founding member of Odonien Records and Planet Sauvage. As a part of Hyeena, he’s the drummer for their trance live shows. His DJ sets are exclusively tailored for the dancefloor, ensuring his listeners engage in extensive dancing. The tension curve only escalates towards exhaustion and satisfaction. His musical range embodies melancholic sounds, massive kicks, and heavily distorted synths—dry sonic insanity spanning between techno, trance, and harder genres.
@hypersapoid

-Ysossios (METANOÏA, Lyon) B2B GIO (Odonien Records, Berlin)-

The musical universe of Ysossios is based on the loss of bearings, a guiding thread he translates into his selections to create a blend of hypnotic and organic sounds with ghetto break and techno beats. A new recruit to the Lyon-based collective Metanoia, Ysossios has been passionate about the rave scene and its values for many years. He makes it a point of honor to reflect this in his sets and projects.
@ysossios

Born in a small village near Perugia, Gio moved from Italy to Germany in 2009. His journey through the clubs began in 2013 and since then he has experimented with different styles, always looking for new influences, from disco to house, from faster realms to downtempo and much more. Since 2018, he has been a resident at Laut Klub in Braunschweig, a club now known for more raw techno. Since 2021, he has been an active member of the collective Rotes Rauschen. Gio brings his passion and versatility to the dance floor to inspire the audience and get them moving.
@610m_p

*w/ MID TEMPO, SLOW  TECH, BASS HOUSE *

-Cyrus (Odonien Records, Cologne)-
With his varied, melodic techno sets, Cyrus aims to create those special moments on the dance floor that make you feel like you're in the right place at the right time. As a founding member of the music label Odonien Records, he has a residency at Cologne's finest techno club Odonien. He has also had the pleasure of presenting his sets in clubs all over Germany and the world, including Club Azul Rosa in Guatemala, Vesica Tulum in Mexico, Bahnwärter Thiel in Munich, and various venues in Berlin, such as Klunkerkranich and Birgitt & Bier.

@cyrus.live
-Ulla & Fabian Porter (Odonien Records, Cologne)-
Odonien Records residents Ulla and Fabian Porter represent midtempo and slowrave on the label. Their sound combines melodic and bouncy elements, characterized by deep vocal lines and gnarly, heavy basslines. From bass house to psy techno to indie dance—the main thing is that it's pitched down.
@fabianportermusic

-Bach & Blüte (Odonien Records, Cologne )-

Brutal beats meet sweet melodies. Tough announcements full of tender empathy—that's how you could describe the bandwidth of the two strategists. Bach & Blüte captivate on the floor with almost mystical presence: an authentic mix of perfect harmony and a good sound thrashing. Bach & Blüte found each other a good decade ago in the turmoil of the Odonien Free State in Cologne, where they remain to this day.
@bachundbluete

lineup: Døpair, Entropy, Flavia Laus, Mar/us, Samantha Togni
information:
Does a leather harness suffice to define you as a master? 
Is a latex bodysuit enough to crown you a submissive? And how does a codified language composed of flogging, restraint, humiliation, sensation play, and intricate rituals delineate the boundaries between being dominant or submissive, a master or mistress, and a servant? 

Historically, sexual behaviors outside the norm have been pathologized, marginalized, and silenced, deemed as disturbances or deviations from the so-called healthy sexuality. This stigmatization mirrors the scientific objectification of emotions, casting kink as a white noise disrupting the societal expectations of sexual conduct. 

In this hypersexualized reality, kink is our revolution, a reclamation of our bodies and desires from the chains of heteronormativity. It is the liberation from rigid roles and labels, allowing us to explore the fluidity of our sexual identities. In the world of kink, pleasure is political, and every act of consensual play is an assertion of our right to exist as we are.

Kink is the anthem of sexual freedom, a declaration of our autonomy, a call to embrace  the beautiful chaos of human sexuality that resists classification and control. It is a space where we honor consent, communication, and the power dynamics that reflect our deepest truths. In the embrace of kink, we find solidarity, community, and the freedom to be unapologetically ourselves.

Be kinky, be yourself.

lineup: Kruder & Dorfmeister ,  Philipp Fein , and many more
information:
KRUDER & DORFMEISTER DJ SET
19:30h Einlass
21:00h Beginn
Support: Philipp Fein (feines Tier)
////////////
Kruder & Dorfmeister’s story is not just a story of refusal and renunciation. As the two started making music together in the early 1990s, there was hardly anything that the two didn’t do “wrong”, and therefore, exactly right.
At the time, Vienna was a metropolis of the aspiring techno movement and was active, during the initial heyday of the revolutionary style. But the two gentlemen, K&D, rather followed the tradition of the continental cosmic “dancefloor” of the 1980s, which searched for a universal language of dance music, influenced by hip hop, rare groove, dub, new wave and last but not least, of music that stood out between all those categories.
As the first post-acid jazz productions of labels like Ninja Tune or Mo Wax heralded a new era, Kruder & Dorfmeister were already a step ahead of those protagonists. The sound of K&D’s groundbreaking debut “G-Stoned”, already apparently influenced by the elegiac arrangements of productions from the 1960s and 1970s of Afro-jazz and Pink Floyd, made many top producers begin scratching the backs of their heads, asking themselves who could have generated such an organically-flowing, complex yet subtle sound with only two Akai samplers, a Roland Space Delay and a dusty mixer.
Offers came pouring in like heavy rainfall in a mid summers day, but the two stubborn gentlemen didn’t play along: after the success of their “DJ-Kicks” and “Sessions” CDs, which sold millions worldwide, they turned down most of them.
K&D always enjoyed not following advice and abandoned all of the enticing major offers, all of the promises of full-speed marketing machinery. Instead, they provided musician friends with distribution on their G-Stone label, hung out in the studio and put together follow-up projects, like Dorfmeister & Huber’s Tosca or Kruder’s Peace Orchestra.
Whoever heard the two DJing at the time, noticed that the cliché of smokey time-loop jazz had long been left behind and gave way to their own spirit of research. Besides excursions to drum & bass and sub-genres, such as broken beat, straight 4/4 rhythms crept into their sets and roughened up the eternal Balearic sunset.
To this day the two still maintain an open concept, influenced by a wide-ranging taste in music and their ability to hear music, to feel and to be able to realize their musical conceptions. Kruder & Dorfmeister’s career can, therefore, be more closely compared to that of major role model, Brian Eno, whose work, from Roxy Music or “My Life in the Bush of Ghosts”, to his productions with David Bowie and his “Music for Airports”, was similarly influenced by an all-embodying, perpetually visionary and never shortsighted understanding of music.
Since the beginning, the goal was to produce a very personalized sound, in which satisfying guidelines of genre was secondary. Peter Kruder ultimately proved that with his productions of DJ Hell’s celebrated “Teufelswerk” and “Zukunftsmusik” albums or Marsmobil’s chart topping “Fairytales Of The Supersurvivor” or the wonderful releases under his own name for Compost, Macro and Gigolo Records. Even Dorfmeister’s Tosca ceaselessly minimalist, almost dadaist tonal studies clearly point in that direction as his collaborations on the acclaimed “The Exchange” album.
So the two are happiest when people take their music and their DJ sets for what they are: odes to hearing, feeling, sensing music and tonal language, which does not function like the many spoken languages of the world, but rather as body language: universal, global, unifying.

event_name: Nils Hoffmann
lineup: Nils Hoffmann
information:
Der aus Berlin stammende Nils Hoffmann hat schon immer Trost in der Musik gefunden. Als klassisch ausgebildeter Pianist wuchs Nils mit der Musik von Produzenten wie Paul Kalkbrenner und Trentemøller auf und wurde dazu inspiriert, melodischen, tiefen und progressiven House zu produzieren.


Heute ist Nils einer der aufregendsten aufstrebenden elektronischen Künstler der Welt und hat sich zum Ziel gesetzt, in die Fußstapfen einiger seiner Lieblingsmusiker*innen zu treten und die nächste Generation von elektronischen Produzenten und Live-Acts anzuführen. Eine große Aufgabe, die er aber mit einigem Erfolg in die Tat umsetzt. Bis heute hat der 27-jährige Produzent über 100 Millionen Streams auf allen Plattformen erreicht.
2022 veröffentlichte Nils sein zweites Album A Radiant Sign über Anjunadeep, welches bereits über 15 Millionen Streams auf allen Plattformen sammeln konnte, Platz 1 der iTunes Dance/Electronic Charts erreicht hat, von BBC und Sirius XM im Radio gespielt wurde und DJ Support von Maceo Plex und Above & Beyond erhielt.


Nils hat auch Remixe für Künstler*innen wie Odesza, San Holo, Emmit Fenn und Eli & Fur veröffentlicht. Der Berliner ist bereits ausgiebig durch Europa, Nordamerika und Australien getourt und hat unter anderem an Orten wie dem Tomorrowland, Printworks, Brooklyn Mirage und The Gorge Amphitheatre gespielt und Künstler*innen wie Ben Bohmer, Gorgon City, Franky Wah, Stephan Bodzin, Tiga und viele mehr supportet.

Ehrenfeld XL 10th Anniversary Club Festival

Ehrenfeld, the vibrant cultural melting pot of Cologne, has long been a beacon for night owls and music enthusiasts. This year, we are thrilled to announce a special edition of Ehrenfeld XL, our iconic club festival, as we celebrate our 10th anniversary. Mark your calendars for Saturday, November 30, 2024, for an unforgettable night that encapsulates the spirit and diversity of Cologne’s subculture.

A Decade of Musical Diversity

For a decade, Ehrenfeld XL has been more than just a festival—it’s been a celebration of life, creativity, and the pulsating soul of the underground. This year’s event promises to be our most eclectic and dynamic yet, featuring a wide array of musical genres and experiences that highlight the ever-evolving nightlife of Ehrenfeld.

What to Expect

Get ready to traverse through different soundscapes as we transform Ehrenfeld into a seamless blend of urban and underground atmospheres. From the deep, bass-heavy techno catacombs to open-air venues that offer a magical view of Cologne’s nocturnal skyline, each location will provide a unique vibe and sound, showcasing the best of Cologne’s nightlife.

Highlights of the Night

	•	Diverse Music Genres: Expect a variety of genres, from techno and house to drum & bass and beyond, each curated to create an immersive auditory experience.
	•	Unique Venues: Experience the charm of Ehrenfeld’s most iconic clubs and hidden gems, each venue offering its own distinct atmosphere.
	•	Special Performances: Look forward to performances by renowned DJs and up-and-coming artists who are set to redefine your expectations.

Join the Celebration

This milestone anniversary of Ehrenfeld XL is not just a festival; it’s a testament to a decade of cultural richness and musical innovation. As we look back on ten years of incredible nights and unforgettable memories, we invite you to be part of this special celebration. Let’s create new memories together and keep the spirit of Ehrenfeld’s nightlife alive and thriving.

See You There

Prepare yourself for a night of ecstatic dancing, vibrant energy, and a community that celebrates diversity and unity through music. Join us on November 30, 2024, and be part of the most captivating party Cologne has to offer.

information: At the core of the Klangkuenstler x Unreal „All Night Long - World Tour“ is a commitment to creating unforgettable experiences that transcend the ordinary nightlife setting. With inspiring visuals, immersive lighting and breaking down the barrier between artist and audience, the crowd is welcomed to surround the DJ, building an intimate atmosphere that fosters unity. The essence of the all night long is the journey it offers, diving deep into the history of the Techno genre throughout Klangkuenstler’s music collection from the late 90s to mid 2010s. It's a marathon of musical exploration which is taking away the pressure to feeling rushed to make an impact in a short set time and forming a strong connection between the artist and the crowd. It will allow the music to unfold organically, build momentum naturally from lower to higher bpm and guide the listeners through the night with an ongoing rhythm and emotions. The synergy with Unreal, which has established itself as a brand of creativity and innovation with its avant-garde approach to event production, will transport the audience into a world where reality blurs.

event_name: Parra for Cuva
lineup: Parra for Cuva
information:
Wenn es ein Wort gibt, das den Sound von Parra for Cuva auf den Punkt bringt, dann ist es "Fernweh". Seine Musik ist vor allem für ihre Weltoffenheit bekannt geworden - ein magisches Terrain, in dem karibische Steeldrums auf uralte Instrumente aus Simbabwe treffen und melodische elektronische Klanglandschaften den Geist an weit entfernte Orte entführen. Es ist dieser Sinn für Offenheit, den der deutsche Elektronikproduzent und Multiinstrumentalist von Anfang an kultiviert hat, und selbst wenn seine Fähigkeiten immer raffinierter und sein Sound immer ausgereifter werden, behält die Musik von Parra for Cuva diese traumwandlerische Qualität, der man nur schwer widerstehen kann.


Der 1991 geborene Nicolas Janco war schon in jungen Jahren von Klängen fasziniert. Sein erstes Studio befand sich in seinem Kinderzimmer in Northeim, einer kleinen Stadt in Deutschland, wo zwei rudimentäre Lautsprecher und ein Midi-Piano zwischen seinen Spielsachen standen. Er begann seine musikalische Reise mit klassischem Klavier, aber seine Begeisterung führte ihn bald zu Ausflügen in Hip-Hop, Jazz, Pop und Indie. Und selbst als er die elektronische Musik entdeckte und kurz darauf nach Berlin zog, um dort zu studieren und eine Karriere als Produzent zu starten, war seine Reise mit verschiedenen Instrumenten und musikalischen Sprachen erst der Anfang. Die Vielfalt der Instrumente in seinem Studio - von Glocken über Flöten bis hin zu Kalimbas und Percussion aller Art - macht deutlich, wie sehr Nicolas ein Klangforscher ist.


Nach Singles, die die Charts stürmten, und zwei gefeierten Alben, Majouré (2014) und Darwîś (2016), gelang Parra for Cuva mit der Veröffentlichung von Paspatou (2018) der Durchbruch. Sein viertes Studioalbum Juno (2021), bei dem er sich nicht scheute, Experimente für die Tanzfläche mit akustischen und ethnischen Klanglandschaften zu vermischen, beinhaltete Kollaborationen mit Musikern aus der ganzen Welt. Parra for Cuva, der mit Zeitgenossen wie Christian Löffler und Max Cooper verglichen wird, die dafür bekannt sind, elektronische Produktionen mit warmen, oft melancholischen analogen Klängen zu verbinden, war auf renommierten Festivals und ausverkauften Bühnen auf der ganzen Welt zu hören, darunter Burning Man und Sziget. Am 19. April kommt sein neues Album Mimose, dass erneut eine fesselnde Klangreise mit spannenden Kollaborationen verspricht.

information:
On Saturday, July 12, 2025, Bon Voyage invites you to an unforgettable night in Cologne! At Common Bon Voyage, you can purchase a ticket for a specific club in the Belgian Quarter or Kwartier Latäng. This ticket guarantees you entry to the chosen club. Additionally, it allows access to all other participating clubs, provided there is space. Take the opportunity to explore various locations and enjoy a diverse musical journey from Techno and House to HipHop and Drum&Bass.

Experience the Pulsating Nightlife of Cologne on an Unforgettable Journey through the Belgian Quarter and Kwartier Latäng!

Discover the vibrant nightlife of Cologne as you embark on a unique adventure through two of its most lively districts: the Belgian Quarter and Kwartier Latäng.

Belgian Quarter: Situated between Rudolfplatz and Friesenplatz, this central scene and nightlife district is the heart of Cologne’s alternative culture. Amidst stylish old buildings, you’ll find eclectic boutiques, art galleries, record stores, and quirky bars, making it a hotspot for night owls.

Kwartier Latäng: This year, we are expanding our event to Kwartier Latäng, an area renowned for its bustling nightlife centered around Zülpicher and Luxemburger streets. Its proximity to the university attracts not only students but also party enthusiasts from all over Cologne. The numerous bars, clubs, and pubs offer a diverse array of musical and culinary experiences.

Musical Diversity: Bon Voyage offers a broad spectrum of music genres: from Techno and House to HipHop, Drum&Bass, Psytrance, and even Charts. This ensures a varied night with something for every taste. Join us as we turn night into day and dance through the best clubs and bars in the city. Bon Voyage provides you with an exceptional club-hopping experience that showcases the diverse facets of Cologne’s party scene.

Electric Rhythms is a DJ collective hailing from France, Germany, and the Netherlands. They invite their audience on a captivating journey through a sonic landscape that blends the futuristic allure of science-fiction-house-music with the delicate charm of floral electro sounds and the relentless drive of automated and progressive techno beats. This collective possesses a wealth of experience in the electronic music realm, and they exclusively utilize vinyl records to skillfully weave their danceable narrative throughout the night.

Prepare for an unforgettable experience as you check in with them at the legend Hotel Europa in Aachen. Put on your dancing shoes and immerse yourself in a night of energy and creativity, set against the backdrop of Aachen's vibrant bohemian enclave.
